content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Labels sensitivity let you classify and protect your organization's data.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Employees may accidentally expose sensitive information to unintended recipients (e.g. send e-mail to incorrect staff member, overshare files with large audience, incorrectly send internal e-mail outside the organization, etc.) if appropriate protection mechanisms are not in place. Such accidents could compromise sensitive information and bring harm to the company and clients. Setting correct Sensitivity Label on the file, e-mail or dataset allows EPAM to correctly identify Sensitive content and effectively apply necessary safeguards to detect and potentially prevent accidental data leaks, as well as sensitive data misuse.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"There are three general Confidentiality classes established in EPAM
